intro: Taraxacum parvicorne, commonly known as the small-horned dandelion, is a species of flowering plant in the family Asteraceae. It is characterized by its basal rosette of hairy, spoon-shaped leaves and a short, hollow stem. The plant produces a single, bright yellow flower head that develops into a fluffy white pappus for seed dispersal. It is native to Europe and is often found in meadows, grasslands, and disturbed soils. Taraxacum parvicorne is a perennial herb that thrives in temperate climates and is known for its medicinal properties.
